item.description:
Mountains are considered to be sacred places in many different cultures around the world. A hike at Ragged Mountain Preserve offers beautiful scenic vistas of lakes and forests, with amazing October Fall foliage as a backdrop.

On top of the Ragged Mountain bluff overlooking Southeastern CT, we will do some light yoga stretching & meditation. Stretches will focus on opening the energy channels of the body, strengthening the energies of the internal organs, and balancing the 5 elemental energies of wood, fire, metal, water and earth. We will end the hike with a light lunch or snack. Please bring a blanket to practice on because the ground may not be good for mats. This is event will end at approximately 12:30 pm.

A $1 donation is requested toward the community center and healing arts space at the Growing Green Co-op.

Driving directions: From Route 9, take exit to Route 71A (High Road) south onto Chamberlain Highway. About 1/4 mile past Roger's Market, turn right (westward) on West Lane. Follow West Lane about 1 mile to West Lane parking area on the right. This is located in Kensington, CT which is a suburb of Berlin. Park on the right side of the road at trailhead gate.

See the town of Berlin's Hiking Trail map (Look for #5 Blue Blazed Trail over Ragged Mnt.)
item.name: Hiking & Yoga - Ragged Mountain
